title: Request a "Recherche d'Emploi ou Création d'Entreprise" (or "APS Jeune diplômé") residence permit (including spouses)
description:
This service is provided by the International Students & Scholars Office (ISSO) of Université Grenoble Alpes to all students, PhD students, researchers and their families studying or working at UGA or in one of our partner institutions in Grenoble and Valence.

Important

  1. This form is intended only for people applying to the "Recherche d'Emploi ou Création d'Entreprise" (or "APS Jeune Diplômé") residence permit, or their spouses.
  2. This service, offered by the International Students & Scholars Office (ISSO) of Université Grenoble Alpes, only aims to facilitate the management of applications. Only Préfecture officers will review and process your application.
  3. Please refer to the complete list of required documents, available on the UGA international website before submitting your application: https://international.univ-grenoble-alpes.fr/getting-organized/visas-and-residence-permits/

For information, it usually takes a week for ISSO to process your application.
Université Grenoble Alpes, 621 avenue centrale 38401 Saint-Martin-d’Hères, is the data controller responsible for processing the information you will give in this form. The data we ask you to provide is necessary to help you in your residence permit application. Only staff members from UGA department of International Affairs (DGD DIT) will be able to access your documents, and your data will be stored in the servers provided by the Direction Interministérielle du Numérique (DINUM). No information will be communicated to anyone outside of the university, and your application file will automatically be deleted after 6 months. If you wish to exercise your rights within the framework of the European Union’s General Data Protection Regulation, you can make a request by contacting: isso@univ-grenoble-alpes.fr.
zones: Ministère de l'Enseignement supérieur et de la Recherche

champDescriptors.label: Reminder
champDescriptors.description:
This service is offered by the Université Grenoble Alpes’ International Students & Scholars Office (ISSO).

> This form is not made to submit directly your application to the Isère or Drôme Prefectures, it only facilitates the management of applications and allows for the verification of “Job Seeking or Business Creation” card applications (and spouses).

> The verification does not guarantee the acceptance of your application by the Préfecture.

> Only applications relating to the status of students and researchers will be verified, any other applications (employees, asylum, etc.) will not be processed.

ISSO does not verify ID photos before your appointment with the Prefecture.
Photos must be recent, taken in France, in a 35 mm x 45 mm – ISO/IEC 19794 – 5: 2005 standard format.

champDescriptors.label: Proof of address
champDescriptors.description: Dated less than 6 months and in your name, or, if you are hosted, in the name of the person hosting you. Documents accepted: * Electricity, gas, water, phone or internet bill * House insurance certificate ("Attestation d’assurance habitation") * Certificate from a student residence ("Attestation de residence") * Rental contract ("Bail") * Rent receipt or bill * Attestation from a hotel (only dated less than a month) along with the last bill.

champDescriptors.label: About your appointment
champDescriptors.description:
Once your application is submitted on this form, ISSO will verify appointment availability with the prefecture in order to offer you the earliest available appointment. You will then receive an email with a proposed date, and if you choose to accept that appointment, a second notification email with the date and time of your appointment. The day of your appointment, bring :
  1. All the copies of the requested documents
  2. Your identity photos (3)
  3. Your passport
  4. Your current residence permit (or the proof of the online validation if you have a visa)
  5. The "Fiche de renseignements" form (only if you apply at the Isère Prefecture (Grenoble)
In September and October, there is a large amount of applications and there can be a waiting period of up to one month. If the first appointment date offered by ISSO is not convenient for you, please note that having another appointment can take several weeks. Please remember that the administration giving the appointments is the prefecture, ISSO is only attempting to make this process easier for you! In the case of an unjustified absence from an assigned appointment, your application will be considered non-priority and the waiting period for receiving another appointment may be prolonged.

champDescriptors.label: Possible unavailability for an appointment
champDescriptors.description: You can indicate any dates or times that do not work with your schedule. ISSO will attempt to take this into account whenever possible (without any guarantee) when giving you an appointment.
